Explorers Hotel at Disneyland¬Æ Paris

50 avenue de la Fosse des Pressoirs, 77700 Magny-le-Hongre, France
  • All Countries
  • Hotels in France
  • Hotels in Ile de France
  • Hotels in Magny-le-Hongre
  • Explorers Hotel at Disneyland¬Æ Paris
  • Family Suites
  • Indoor Swimming Pool
  • Children Playground
  • Game Room
  • Water Park
  • Child Services

Description

All of the guest rooms come with a TV with international channels and offer tea and coffee making facilities. Family rooms which can accommodate up to 6 guests in one room are also available at Explorers Disneyland Paris.

A continental buffet breakfast is included in the price for all guests at the Explorers hotel and guests can also purchase full English breakfast items to add to their meal. The 3 onsite restaurants offer guests a choice of traditional cuisine, pizza and buffet options. There is also a bar and an on-site shop where guests can order snacks such as muffins, doughnuts, cookies and hot drinks.

In addition to the heated indoor swimming pool with slides, there is also a children's adventure playground and a Disney souvenir shop. Free Wi-Fi access is available throughout the property.

The property is 2.5 mi from the Val d'Europe RER Station and shopping center and 4.3 mi from exit 14 of the A4 motorway. Free parking is available on site.

  • This property has many entertainment options for kids and that is always a plus.
  • This property has large rooms available which could make a more pleasant stay.

- 07/10/2018 -

I enjoyed the stay due to fact we were never there as we...

"I enjoyed the stay due to fact we were never there as we booked for 3 days which was plenty for the hotel stay but not enough for Disneyland. The hotel was dirty the palm trees inside have that much dust the trees dropped to the floor. The floor has stains all over carpets where leaks had happened. The room it's self had no fridge and for a family hotel you would expect this due to babies and milk etc. The fan was pointless and noisy. The staff were rude and i can only assume it was because we didn't speak french, except one gentlemen who we cant thank enough for helping us- Cederick @ reception! The pool had that much chlorine it made your skin itch. No lifeguards were seen in the pool area for our whole duration it was like a zoo which was so dangerous. Kids of 3 -4 years old come flying down slides with other kids in tow people at bottom of slides. I saw and experienced a few near misses myself . The shuttle service and location of hotel was amazing could fault it every 20 mins and 10 mind away from Disney. The food however was not so great. This hotel needs some TLC"

- 05/22/2018 -

Simple accommodation convenient to Disneyland Paris.

"This was a fun place to stay for the two days we were visiting Disneyland Paris. It was, predictably, over-run with kids and "the sort of people who go to Disneyland" (which I suppose we have now become!), and the level of sophistication that that entails. The dining options were quite limited, but we actually found the buffet restaurant fit the bill for us perfectly both nights we stayed there. The pool area was something my daughter had been looking forward to for ages, and it lived up to her expectations. Our room was comfortable and had all the amenities we required, and we were also fortunate enough to be allocated a room on the ground floor (same floor as reception), which was convenient and not noisy as anticipated. The shuttle buses to and from Disneyland were convenient, and run fairly frequently."

Fantastic 3 star for families

"I don‚Äôt usually book 3 star hotels but chose the hotel due to its child friendly decor and set up and it definitely delivered on that front. There was a lovely pool with a water slide etc as well as a pirate ship and indoor play area. Theme and bunk beds very great. The staff were fantastic. I would like to say a big thank you to the lady who was on the Saturday night shift. My child was ill and she promptly arranged for an ambulance and stayed to translate. She even arranged a late check out for us. If you are looking for a great kids experience without paying extortionate rates then I definitely recommend. If you are looking for adult luxury (Spa‚Äôs, room service etc) then this won‚Äôt be for you as it has definitely been design with kids at the forefront."

Window opens. Quiet in the room. Had a great meal at Captain Library & fairly fast but decent pizza in the food hall the 1st night. Good micro brew beer (Parisienne) available! A great way to end our tour of Breton/Norman old stuff so the kids were able to enjoy the vacation to its fullest. Didn't even do Disney, and that meant the pool and activities were all ours during the day!"

"Excellent family hotel. We all loved the waterpark, such an excellent facility (although the showers were cold so we had to dash back to the room to shower). The soft play was a bonus too. Cleanliness was fine - not perfect, but OK for a big budget hotel. All the staff we interacted with were helpful and friendly, and again with it being a big budget hotel I imagine their jobs are not always the easiest. We got upgraded to a bigger room as our room wasn't ready, it was nice to put the kids in their own bedroom. Breakfast was busy but didn't take long to get seated and there was plenty of choice."

- 08/10/2017 -

Amazing!

"Myself and my 3 young children have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Explorers, and we had such an amazing time. As soon as we arrived on Friday night the kids were straight in the pool, which has 3 water slides and a big pirate head which empties water out from above the pool. It's open until 23.00 so we ended up here every night, even after our busy day. There is also a soft play, an indoor and out outdoor play area as well as a games room, all of which my kids enjoyed and had lots of fun! There is also a 6D cinema, which was great fun. The room we had wasn't massive, but for 1 adult and 3 children it was fine, given we were hardly there. Breakfast is a continental buffet which consists of croissants, ham, cheese, yogurts, fruit salad etc. It can get busy the later you go, so I would recommend getting there as early as you can. I found this perfect for young kids as they can eat as much or as little as they wanted of whatever they wanted. We also went to the buffet style restaurant in the evening which was reasonably priced and had foods such as beef, fish, rice etc as well as delicious desserts. Again this was perfect for the kids and they refused to eat anywhere else. My eldest preferred it to any of the restaurants at the Disney parks.Disneyland and the train station are less than a 10 minute shuttle bus ride away, which picks up in the hotel.It was my eldest child's 10th Birthday during our stay and I paid for a celebration package from the hotel. This included balloons in our room, a soft toy which was the hotels character, sweets and he had a cinema voucher. The hotel also made an amazing cake (see pic) for him and sang happy birthday to him in the restaurant! He was so happy. Thank you explorers hotel! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for families and would definitely stay again. P"

Great hotel for kids!

I would advise couples and families WITHOUT children to stay away from this hotel)) If you are used to quiet, '4 seasons' type hotel with room service - then Explorers hotel is not for you!! Shuttle service to Disney parks was very quick, 5-10 mins wait and less than 5mins ride."

Good luggage storage facilities. We had dinner at the restaurant and the servings were huge. 3 of us could have shared the bowl of spaghetti , which was suitable for kids but not a fancy meal. The free shuttle bus, although a little crowded, got us to the parks and back very quickly with no hassle. I would definetly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Disney who doesn't want to spend too much on a hotel."

- 05/22/2017 -

Very good "standard" hotel

"The hotel is very close to the Disney Parks, and has a free bus shuttle to and from- hard to turn down! The hotel room was quite large, had a couch, and a fully laid-out bathroom set-up (NOT something you can take for granted around London or Paris). I guess around Paris the toilet is in a different area than the shower- a bit funny but alright. There's a shop on-location, and it's got a bunch of stuff for families (the pool, the play area).It feels very much like a nice, solid, "typical" hotel with some good extras for families- the price wasn't too steep, especially compared to the "authentic" Disney hotels- for only a bit more than I paid to stay in London or Paris, I had a TON of stuff. You pay more than you would in a comparable hotel at Walt Disney World, but only by a bit- and hey, it's Paris."

- 04/06/2017 -

The themed hotel was so much fun for our kids!

"The themed hotel was so much fun for our kids! The value for money was excellent in my opinion, although the quality of some aspects of the hotel definitely seemed 'budget'. Breakfast was great and most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We forgot swim diapers for our little kids but they sell items like that individually in a vending machine at the pool, which was very handy. (2.50e per diaper, 8e for kids' swim trunks/suits, 12e for adult swim trunks/suits). Our kids loved the indoor play area, too."

- 04/06/2017 -

Nice hotel, slightly remote

"The pool and the late opening hours which were a bonus for the children. The breakfast was good and it was convenient having the shuttle for transfer to the parks."

- 04/05/2017 -

Fantastic hotel

"The cost of my room hadn't specified breakfast but when we got there it was included which was a huge bonus for five people. I would advise bringing cordial for the kids likes the robinsons shots as only fizzy drinks and pure juices available so handy to have for going to the parks. Shuttle bus so handy and none of the pushing and shoving stories I kept hearing. Magic shuttle dropped us within half an hour of the airport. My Mam had a fall in Disney park requiring quick trip to hospital for a stitch which Disney facilitated but hotel then faxed our European travel card details and passport to hospital to ensure we weren't charged. Really helpful and no trouble to them.The pool was a fantastic asset to the hotel, its the main reason I picked the explorers, the facilities for kids. Men cannot wear loose shorts in pool but trunks available in vending machine in pool area. Also towels available to rent so don't waste space bringing towels the towel can be dried and reused if you wish. It was very relaxed very family friendly very safe. The kids were devastated leaving!"

- 04/04/2017 -

At meal times there was a good choice of food and lots of it! The pool was brilliant, the children (6 & 8) loved it! Buses to Disneyland were regular. I would definitely stay here again."

- 03/14/2017 -

Great Service, Location and Facilities

"The facilities for the kids are exceptional, 2 indoor playgrounds,a games room, an outdoor pirate playground and a 6D cinema. The pool had 3 different slides and a pirate ship with lots of activities. Staff at the desk were extremely helpful and very informative. The hotel is the first pick up on the shuttle bus to the park and the first drop off in the evenings. The room had a radiator which we could adjust and a fan on the ceiling if it got too warm. Far exceeded our expectations and great value for money. We will definitely be back."

- 11/27/2016 -

Nice hotel that kids will enjoy

"Great fun for kids. Swimming pool for the youngest, indoor play park, nice decoration, games and a buffet."

- 11/27/2016 -

great location for DisneyLand

"We stayed here to be close to Disneyland Paris, the price was fair, rooms were very clean and the staff was very polite. They offer wi-fi for free which was nice to check in with people after a day at Disneyland. The shuttle bus '54' runs regularly from the Explorers hotel, it seemed about 15-20 minutes depending on the time and day. One tip to consider when planning your day is the hotel is the first of many stops when going to Disneyland, so the ride takes about 25-30 minutes from pick-up at the hotel to walking through the entrance of DisneyLand. The ride home is much shorter with the bus stopping at Explorers Hotel first, 10 minutes for the ride back to the hotel.The food court was nice, there is a happy hour every day from 7pm-8pm with half-price drinks, so you can get a couple pints for 8 euro's or so. The pizza was good and quick for the kids after a full day in the amusement park. There was other food options in the hotel that were sit down restaurants but we didn't try them. The continental breakfast was good, exactly what you would expect from a european continental breakfast."

- 11/26/2016 -

Fantastic hotel for families

"Explorer's Hotel is a fantastic hotel for families. My kids (ages 5 and 7) loved it. They had a blast. There is an indoor playground, outdoor playground, heated pool with slides and waterplay. Free breakfast (continental, extra fee for cooked eggs, bacon) was fine. Free wifi, free parking, and free shuttle to Disneyland. Great place to stay and lots of fun to be had after returning from Disney. We would stay here again."

- 11/26/2016 -

Comfortable, friendly, family environment

"Very family friendly. Our kids really enjoyed the pool and play areas. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. The shuttle service to the Disney Parks ran for a long time so it was very convenient going from place to place."

- 11/09/2016 -

A great stay at Disney, outstanding location & transport links.Really enjoyed our stay.

"There was ample food! A good choice, fresh & tasty. It was a verygenerous continental breakfast drinks good choice too! There was queuesbut they went down quickly, it was busy inside with slight queues forfood & drinks but that is all over dlp! Excellent play areas forchildren - the pool & pirate ships kept my child more thanentertained. The rooms where of a great size, separate toilet, seperarebathroom - I was particularly impressed with the washing line in thebathroom. Plenty storage space for towels & toiletries. Greatquality telly with good selection of English channels. Decent coffee inroom. Very well priced & decent sandwich shop & shop for gifts& confectionary."

- 10/07/2016 -

Lovely stay near Disney Land.

"The kids loved the decorated rooms and hotel. It was neat and we had a lovely stay. The free breakfast was also a bonus. The kids loved the play area. There is a free shuttle bus to the park and train station. I took a direct train from there to Paris and back. It is about an hour to the city. The hotel ordered a taxi for us from the airport, but we went back to the airport by train. There is a direct train to CDG airport that only takes 10 min. We checked out early morning, but we could use their facilities for the day till it was time to leave for the airport."

Great Value of Money With Excellent Location from Disneyland

Hence, there is no need to have a car if you plan to spend 1 to 2 days in Disneyland Park and Studio.We upgraded to a Suite and was very comfortable for 2 adults and 2 children.Sixt rental office is walking distance from the apartment."

- 09/06/2016 -

Perfect trip to Disney the hotel made our holiday even more special.

"Loved this hotel, couldn't believe some of the things people complained about when I was reading the reviews.. Most of the staff speak upto 4 different languages brilliantly, all happy to help of you need anything. Facilities were fab plenty to do once you've come back from Disney. They have a Disney shop, restaurant, bar and even a little pizza cabin that's open until late. Yes people stay up with their children but what do you expect?? You've booked a family hotel with a giant play boat inside of course it's going to be a little busy/noisy. Pool is a little deep so just keep an extra eye on any little ones using the slides. Apart from that everything's clean and well kept. Also a few complained about the heat, you've book a hotel with no aircon in the middle of the French summer of course it's going to be warm. Use your common sense shut the curtains and open the window through the day. I requested a fridge before going and they provided one. Shuttle buses straight to Disney. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again."

- 09/06/2016 -

"Location good, as first drop off/pick up on No 54 pink bus. Decent facilities and rooms, kids loved the pool which was open til late."

Hotel Staff helpful and great family rooms without the need for anyone to sleep on a sofa bed! We were behind the communal space and lift so the free wifi reached our room which was great but it would be better to generally have in all rooms. Staff uniforms reinforced the theme and added to the magic for the kids. Overall good value for money in terms of cost of accommodation and the kids adored it and are desperate to go back!"

There great places to eat and a gift shop and pools. The grounds are great form morning walks/runs. The staff were so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. In fact I bought chocolates on my last day for them to thank them for such great service. There's a free shuttle bus service to Disneyland that arrives every few minutes, it's about a 15 minute ride to the park. Nice an quick ! This hotel is just so fantastic and really good for the money for a Disney hotel. Whether your bringing your kids or coming with your friends or partner - this is the hotel you need to book !"

- 10/06/2015 -

Perfect for our 6-year-old.

"Perfect for our 6-year-old. He loved the water park, the pirate ship and ball park, almost better than Disney itself! The room was comfortable with plenty of storage space, a fun, bright and cheery design and comfy beds. Great to have English channels too even CBeebies! The staff were friendly and everything was kept clean and tidy, despite the number of young kids running around! I wouldn't recommend the buffet (a bit bland and luke warm) but the pizzas weren't bad. Breakfast is a bit chaotic but it's part of the fun and to be expected when you're catering for that many families. Shuttle to Disney worked well (every 15 mins and takes 5). Would definitely recommend it to friends with children under 10 who are going to Disney. The wi-fi worked well too."

- 08/08/2015 -

The hotel is very good for kids, the pool is excellent and...

"The hotel is very good for kids, the pool is excellent and opens from 0800h to 1100hrs, the are two indoor play areas one being a soft play area and an outdoor play area so plenty to amuse smaller children. There is also a games room for older children but children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult. Hotel is quite big and breakfast time is very busy but food is plentiful, cooked breakfasts have an additional charge. Room are compact but suitable and clean with cleaning services everyday. Any staff I dealt with were helpful and friendly. Gift shop prices are the same as Disneyland. Free shuttle bus every 10-15mins to and from Disneyland so all round a great service. Good hotel for 3 star, don't expect 4/5 star service, you get what you pay for but is affordable for families who want the Disneyland experience without paying a fortune."

- 03/24/2015 -

The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful.

"The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. My flight got in early and they let me check in a few hours early and I was upgraded to a suite for free. A good amount of the staff speaks English but if you want to try out your french go for it! They welcome it. This is the ultimate hotel for kids and adults from the pool with the 2 water slides and the dry play area for kids inside and outside that they do not advertise. My kids absolutely loved it. For men going to the pool they do enforce the French policy of wearing speedos. They lent me one for free for my son. The staff will also lend you arm floaties for children if you go to the deep end of the pool. As a single parent traveling to this hotel with 3 small children I felt comfortable going around and did not worry about anything."
